title: Worked Solution
text:
To find the equation in slope-intercept form, we first need to find the slope of the line.

slope $$=$$ (change in y)/(change in x) $$=$$ $$ rac{4-\left(-3ight)}{3-0}$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{7}{3}$$

Now we can use the point-slope form of the equation:

$$y$$ - y1 $$=$$ m(x - x1)

where $$m$$ is the slope and (x1, y1) is one of the given points. Let's use point $$(3,4)$$:

$$y$$ - $$4$$ $$=$$ (7/3)(x - 3)

Now we can solve for $$y$$ and simplify:

$$y$$ - $$4$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{7}{3} x$$ - $$7$$
$$y$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{7}{3} x$$ - $$3$$

This is the equation of the line in slope-intercept form.
